SEARCH
Package Person

Class Guest

java.lang.Object
Person.Person
Person.Guest
public class Guest extends Person
The Guest class represents a guest in the cruise booking system.

This class extends the Person class and provides additional functionality specific to guests, such as account creation and handling password reset requests.

Key features of the Guest class include:

  • Account creation for guests using the createAccount method.
  • Retrieval of password reset requests from the database using the getResetRequests method.

  • Constructor Details

    • Guest

      public Guest(String username, String password, String name, String address, String email, String number, YearMonth expirationDate, Boolean isCorporateGuest)
      Constructs a new Guest object with the specified attributes.

      This constructor initializes a guest with the provided username, password, name, address, and email by calling the constructor of the superclass, User, with the same parameters. Additionally, it initializes the reservations list as an empty ArrayList and sets the system default time zone to the guest's clock.

      Parameters:
      username - the username for the guest.
      password - the password for the guest's account.
      name - the name of the guest.
      address - the address of the guest.
      email - the email address of the guest.

    • Guest

      public Guest(String username, String password, String name, String address, String email)

  • Method Details

    • usernameExists

      public static boolean usernameExists(String username)
      Checks whether a given username already exists in the 'LOGINDATA' table of the database.

      This method connects to the 'cruiseDatabase' using JDBC, executes a SELECT query to search for the provided username in the 'LOGINDATA' table, and returns true if the username exists, and false otherwise.

      Parameters:
      username - the username to check for existence in the database.
      Returns:
      true if the username exists, false otherwise.

    • createAccount

      public boolean createAccount()
      Creates a new guest account by invoking the createGenericAccount method with the account type set to "GUEST".

      This method acts as a convenient wrapper for the generic account creation process, specifically tailored for creating guest accounts.

      Returns:
      true if the guest account is successfully created, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Person.createGenericAccount(String)

    • resetRequest

      public static void resetRequest(String username, String password)
      Submits a password reset request for a given username in the 'LOGINDATA' table.

      This method connects to the 'cruiseDatabase' using JDBC and performs the following steps:

      1. Checks if the provided username exists in the 'LOGINDATA' table.
      2. If the username exists, checks if a password reset request for the user already exists.
      3. If no existing password reset request is found, inserts a new entry in the 'PASSWORDRESETS' table.
      Parameters:
      username - the username for which the password reset request is submitted.
      password - the new password to be set after the reset.

    • resetPassword

      public void resetPassword()
      The resetPassword method is responsible for updating the password in the database for a given user and removing any corresponding password reset entries.

      This method performs the following steps:

      1. Establishes a connection to the database.
      2. Updates the user's password in the 'LOGINDATA' table.
      3. Deletes any password reset entries for the user in the 'PASSWORDRESETS' table.
      4. Commits the changes to the database.
      If an exception occurs during the process, it prints the stack trace and attempts to rollback the changes in the case of a SQLException.

      Finally, it ensures that the database connection is closed.

    • writeReservation

      public boolean writeReservation(LocalDate start, LocalDate end, Cruise cruise, Room room)
      Writes a new reservation entry to the 'RESERVATIONS' table in the database.

      This method connects to the 'cruiseDatabase' using JDBC and inserts a new reservation entry with the specified details into the 'RESERVATIONS' table. It includes the username, room ID, total cost, start date, end date, reservation date, and cruise name.

      Parameters:
      start - the start date of the reservation.
      end - the end date of the reservation.
      cruise - the cruise associated with the reservation.
      room - the room to be reserved.
      Returns:
      true if the reservation is successfully written to the database, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Room.getTotalCost(LocalDate, LocalDate)

    • generateBilling

      public void generateBilling(double cost)

    • calculateRefund

      public double calculateRefund(int reservationId)

    • makeReservation

      public boolean makeReservation(Room room, LocalDate start, LocalDate end, Cruise cruise)
      Initiates the reservation process for a specified room, time period, and cruise.

      This method facilitates the reservation process by invoking the writeReservation method to create a reservation entry in the database. It then updates the local reservations list by calling the getReservations method and returns a boolean value indicating the success of the reservation.

      Parameters:
      room - the room to be reserved.
      start - the start date of the reservation.
      end - the end date of the reservation.
      cruise - the cruise associated with the reservation.
      Returns:
      true if the reservation is successfully made, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • writeReservation(LocalDate, LocalDate, Cruise, Room)
      • getReservations()

    • cancelReservation

      public boolean cancelReservation(int reservationId)
      Cancels a reservation with the specified reservation ID.

      This method connects to the 'cruiseDatabase' using JDBC and performs the following steps:

      1. Checks if a reservation with the provided reservation ID exists in the 'RESERVATIONS' table.
      2. If the reservation exists, checks if the start date of the reservation is before the current date.
      3. If the reservation's start date is before the current date, the cancellation is not allowed, and false is returned.
      4. Deletes the reservation entry from the 'RESERVATIONS' table.
      5. Removes the canceled reservation from the local reservations list.
      6. Returns true if the reservation is successfully canceled, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      reservationId - the ID of the reservation to be canceled.
      Returns:
      true if the reservation is successfully canceled, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • getReservations()
      • Guest.Reservation

    • modifyReservation

      public boolean modifyReservation(int reservationId, Room room, LocalDate start, LocalDate end, Cruise cruise)
      Modifies a reservation with the specified reservation ID, updating details such as the room, dates, and cruise.

      This method connects to the 'cruiseDatabase' using JDBC and performs the following steps:

      1. Checks if the provided start and end dates are valid for the given cruise using Cruise.areDatesValid.
      2. If the dates are valid, updates the reservation details in the 'RESERVATIONS' table.
      3. Calculates the total cost for the updated reservation based on the new room and date range.
      4. Returns true if the reservation is successfully modified, false otherwise.
      Parameters:
      reservationId - the ID of the reservation to be modified.
      room - the new room for the reservation.
      start - the new start date for the reservation.
      end - the new end date for the reservation.
      cruise - the new cruise for the reservation.
      Returns:
      true if the reservation is successfully modified, false otherwise.
      See Also:
      • Cruise.areDatesValid(LocalDate, LocalDate)
      • Room.getTotalCost(LocalDate, LocalDate)

    • getReservations

      public List<Guest.Reservation> getReservations()
      Retrieves all reservations for the guest from the 'RESERVATIONS' table.

      This method connects to the 'cruiseDatabase' using JDBC, executes a SELECT query to retrieve all reservations for the guest from the 'RESERVATIONS' table, and returns a list of Reservation objects representing the guest's reservations.

      Returns:
      a list of Reservation objects representing the guest's reservations.
      See Also:
      • Guest.Reservation
